channel.title: Members on Bates Fluid Dynamics Group
channel.description: Recent content in Members on Bates Fluid Dynamics Group
channel.copyright: © Jeffrey S. Oishi, 2018-present; banner image NASA/SWRI/MSSS/Gerald Eichstädt/Seán Doran

item.title: Tucker Barber
item.description: Tucker is writing his senior thesis on testing the forthcoming Dedalus-bio software package for biophysics simulations in collaboration with Phil Pearce at Harvard Medical School and the Dedalus team.

item.title: Alex Jiang
item.description: Alex is working on his senior thesis on the topological properties of torsional oscillations in the Earth’s core. He’s also worked on Active Matter simulations.

item.title: Anthony Okonkwo
item.description: Anthony is a senior thesis student working on fluid-structure interactions using immersed boundary methods in Dedalus. Hobbies

item.title: Avi Brach-Neufeld
item.description: Avi is writing his senior thesis on the Goldreich-Schubert-Fricke instability. Hobbies

item.title: Becca Minsley
item.description: Becca is just joining the group. She’s going to work with Alex on Active Matter. Hobbies

item.title: Deveena Banerjee
item.description: Deveena hails from Sacramento, CA. She’s interested in magnetohydrodynamic simulations. Hobbies

item.title: Fahim Khan
item.description: Fahim is developing a dashboard for managing supercomputer simulations. Hobbies

item.title: Hannah Beams
item.description: Hannah is just joining the group. She’s starting a project to simulate the KPZ equation in Dedalus. Hobbies

item.title: Jeff Oishi
item.description: Jeff grew up in Virginia, just outside Washington, D. C. Hobbies Loud music, synthesizers, bicycles, cats.

item.title: Kirstin Koepnic
item.description: Kirstin is writing her senior thesis on topological protection in fluid systems.

item.title: Matt Goldberg
item.description: Matt wrote his senior thesis on the formation of jets on the 2-sphere using a very primative version of what is now Dedalus 3. He is now a PhD student in Computational Science, Engineering, and Mathematics at UT Austin.

item.title: Mike Bancroft
item.description: Mike hails from New Hampsire. He’s now working at Dartmouth College. Hobbies skiing

item.title: Morgan Baxter
item.description: Morgan wrote his senior thesis on applying the Generalized Quasi-linear Approximation to Taylor-Couette flows. Before that, Morgan completed an eigenvalue analysis of the 3D magnetorotational instability. As of 2021, he’s pursuing a Master’s Degree in Aerospace Engineering at University of Colorado, Boulder. Hobbies

item.title: Muhammad Abdullah
item.description: Abdullah is working on the thermal asymptotic suction boundary layer problem.

item.title: Reed Feldman
item.description: Reed developed a web framework for managing and creating Dedalus jobs from simulation parameter design documents. Hobbies

item.title: Sam Huebschmann
item.description: Sam completed his senior thesis by building a Raspberry pi “supercomputer.” Hobbies
